snippet: A hole in a pipe in North Carolina has leaked up to 82,000 tons of coal ash mixed with 27 million gallons of contaminated water into the river since it was discovered Sunday.
abstract: Hundreds of workers at a Duke Energy power plant scramble to plug a hole in a pipe at the bottom of a 27-acre pond that has leaked up to 82,000 tons of coal ash mixed with 27 million gallons of contaminated water into the Dan River in North Carolina.
lead_paragraph: A hole in a pipe in North Carolina has leaked up to 82,000 tons of coal ash mixed with 27 million gallons of contaminated water into the river since it was discovered Sunday.

headline.main: Power Plant Workers Try to Plug Coal Ash Leak in North Carolina
headline.print_headline: Power Plant Workers Try to Plug Coal Ash Leak in North Carolina
